chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 22-year-old male who presented with jaundice and pruritus after using the supplement Albutarex V2. Lab results from Table 1 show peak values: AST 70 U/L, ALT 137 U/L, ALP 326 U/L, total bilirubin 41.66 mg/dL, direct bilirubin 41.5 mg/dL, INR 1.3. Albumin is not mentioned. The clinical outcome is full resolution of liver chemistries at 6 months after cessation, indicating improvement/discharge.

lab_results.Bilirubin: Total bilirubin 41.66 mg/dL, Direct bilirubin 41.5 mg/dL
